summary: Apply a process to each array element
description: Applies a process to each individual value in the array. This is basically what other languages call either a `for each` loop or a `map` function.

parameters.name: process
parameters.description: A process that accepts and returns a single value and is applied on each individual value in the array. The process may consist of multiple sub-processes and could, for example, consist of processes such as ``abs()`` or ``linear_scale_range()``.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The value of the current element being processed.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the current element being processed.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: The label of the current element being processed. Only populated for labeled arrays.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Additional data passed by the user.

returns.description: The value to be set in the new array.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Additional data to be passed to the process.

returns.description: An array with the newly computed values. The number of elements are the same as for the original array.
